messages.message: Hey @sean.donohoe wanted to see if theres anything I can do to lower the storage use on my sandbox? It appears very full (443gb used out of 484) but when i run tools (du),  from within the sandbox itself, the most i can account for is 24gb https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/arkadiuszbalata?cw=dev
Have you tried running `docker system prune -a`?
+1 for a docker prune, will poke around your sandbox as well

Not sure if this helps, but for me, i found a giant log file in file-service
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1727908183464909?thread_ts=1727907297.058859&cid=C05L87V014J
yeah I get the feeling it's going to be something similar @Xindi Xu -- I'm running `sudo ncdu / --exclude-kernfs` on Arek's host now, hopefully that'll clear things up whenever it finishes
definitely looks like docker's the offender
